name: SearchSubscriptions
description:
Search for subscriptions by location and customer IDs.

This tool searches for subscriptions, ordering them by creation date, location, and optionally by customer IDs. If no location or customer IDs are provided, it searches across all available locations and customers.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for fetching the next set of subscription results if previous results exceeded the limit. If not set, returns the last page of results.

value_schema.description:
When the total number of resulting subscriptions exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
specify the cursor returned from a preceding response here to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

parameters.name: max_subscriptions_returned
parameters.description: Defines the maximum number of subscriptions to return in a single response.

value_schema.description:
The upper limit on the number of subscriptions to return
in a paged response.

parameters.name: customer_ids_to_filter
parameters.description: A list of customer IDs to filter subscriptions by. Leave empty to include all customers.

value_schema.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the subscribing customer IDs.

parameters.name: filter_by_location_ids
parameters.description: An array of location IDs to filter subscriptions by location.

value_schema.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the location.

parameters.name: filter_by_source_applications
parameters.description: A list of source application names to filter subscriptions by.

value_schema.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the source application.

parameters.name: include_related_info
parameters.description: Specify related information to include in the response, such as 'actions' for scheduled actions on subscriptions.

value_schema.description:
An option to include related information in the response. 

The supported values are: 

- `actions`: to include scheduled actions on the targeted subscriptions.
